definition: the Rites of Zhou (in Confucianism)
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
week/weekly/variant of 周[zhou1]
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy

sentences.english: Zhou Dynasty's historiographers and Zhouli have a close relationship.
sentences.chinese: 周代史官与周礼之间有着密切的关系。

sentences.english: Binxing is a kind of etiquette for commending and learning encouragement, which is origin from "Zhou".
sentences.chinese: 宾兴起源于《周礼》，是一种表彰和劝学的礼仪。

sentences.english: Finally, evaluation is made of the observation method and the original definitions in the optical classification system.
sentences.chinese: 最后对《周礼》十𪸩这个光象分类体系进行了评价。

sentences.english: Moreover, they also guard Zhouli by special written laws.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他们还通过特殊的“书法”方式捍卫周礼。

sentences.english: Sun Yirang essays, "Zhou justice, " the book still made for the Duke of Zhou.
sentences.chinese: 孙诒让撰《周礼正义》，仍以此书为周公所作。

sentences.english: " (3)?So Liu Xin as "Zhou" is said to benefit the prevalence of Qing Dynasty and the .
sentences.chinese: 于是刘歆作《周礼》之说，至清季而益盛行。

sentences.english: The history value of sacrificial words in ZhouLi .
sentences.chinese: 《周礼》祭祀词语的词汇史研究价值。

sentences.english: Chapter four discuss the question about military service system in"Zhou Li".
sentences.chinese: 第四章重点讨论《周礼》中的兵役制度。

sentences.english: During Chunqiu period, Fatality Order declined and Zhou Rite was faced with legitimacy crises.
sentences.chinese: 春秋以降，天命陨落，周礼出现严重的合法性危机。

definition: Classic of Rites
Zhou dynasty (1046-221 BC)
Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
Classic of Rites (same as 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
etiquette/system of rites
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Luxuriant Dew of the Spring and Autumn Annals, ideological tract by Han dynasty political philosopher Dong Zhongshu 董仲舒[Dong3 Zhong4 shu1]
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
(Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)
Guliang Annals, commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], first published during the Han Dynasty
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
Zuo Zhuan or Tsochuan, Mr Zuo's Annals or Mr Zuo's commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history c. 400 BC attributed to famous blind historian Zuo Qiuming 左丘明[Zuo3 Qiu1 ming2]
the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
